A young $theFaction officer has taken a liking to you, making modifications to his nobu cosplay to be closer to your image. It makes sure that patrol commanders are not sure whenever it is you or the fanboy.

The $faction Nobu have started talking about your value as a reliable asset, some of them are willing to give you some extra leeway on the loot distrbution.This shows mostly as low-grade surplus military equipment, and pinning your crimes on a rival Nobu.
You're not generally well known by $faction officials, for good or ill, nobu make caricatures of your face to use in comics, just like with every other spacer.
Though nothing has been proven (yet), $faction officials tend to view you with distrust. You have caught more than one Nobu stealing bolts from your ships.

Suspicions have risen to an actionable level. Nobus sneer and joke at your expense, some of the more spiteful ones make hand-crafted pi�atas with your face. $faction ports will be closed to your ilk, and patrols look to prevent your mischievious plans.

$Faction commanders have authorization to engage your fleet on sight, Nobu�s have an industrial line set up for the production of pots bearing a resemblence to your second�s ass and another for bats in image of the Emperor�s Sword.

Once a foolish Nobu got caught writing smutty fanfic about you, he got burned at the stake, and his ashes stomped into the dirt. Nobu History nerds are stalking Nobu-pedia begging for the opportunity to change "is" to "was".

You are known by the Order Grandmaster itself,  $theFaction recognizes you as a charitable soul, high-level officials are looking to network with a condecorated hero of the States. You are given much leeway, and may receive trade concessions and access to high-quality ships and munitions.
You're relatively well-known within $theFaction, whether in person or by reputation. Most members of the Order will come to your aid, as a fellow spacer.
You have a benefactor in $theFaction, seeing how much you have done in their stead. Harassing you is therefore a more risky endeavor for local patrol commanders.

The $faction officials tend to view you favorably, though this has little in the way of implications. At best, you might be sold some low-grade surplus military equipment, or avoid being the target of an investigation if a more convenient scapegoat is available.
Your kit was upgraded with a cute plushie of a Hypogriff.
You're are a unknown in $faction system, yet you recieve the standart starfarer support kit from the knights HQ, it come with a Gila monster Decal.
Though nothing has been proven (yet), $faction officials tend to view you with distrust.Some drunk knights make an unsavory comments, on top of a mean comparison with an Iguana.

Suspicions have risen to an actionable level. The Knights are keeping a good eye on you, $faction ports will be closed to your ilk, and patrols look to prevent your mischievious plans, you slinky-like iguana.

$Faction commanders have authorization to engage your fleet on sight, and all markets are prohibited from trading with you. The Knights have posted a caution phamplet for travelers with your face and name in bold red.

You can find a holo of your face with clown makeup and somebody giving you a wedgie in almost every planet, doctored for sure. Ast has actually taken note of much of a jerk you are, so he is a bit dissapointed. The Order has a private betting ring going for who gets your head.
"Nobbu? Nobbu� Nobbu"

script:
AddText "Moonial�s main port is brimming with seedy and shifty indviduals, barely contained by a scrawny guard post. You take out your cargo manifest and credentials, getting throught the checkpoint. You can see some old merc veterans giving a scolding to some thugs, most of the traffic seems to go towards the habitation complex." marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "A holoprojector shows an ad for an opportunity in the farms of Ethoi, a tired person mans a booth handing out phamplets explaining the union benefits to anybody who approaches." marketFlavorTextColor

AddText "When the port authority detects your approach, it directs you towards the back of the comms tower, where a Knight let�s you pass and enter directly to the purple area of the market, it�s small and cramped, the smell of dry cum and sanitizer impregnates the air, and the sticky pieces of hair cover the floor." marketFlavorTextColor

AddText "The Washi castle dominates the montainous lanscape of the planet, with housing and some scarse temples dotted around it, the streets are bustling with activity, the Nobus covering every inch like a tide of laborious ants." marketFlavorTextColor
AddText "You manage dodge a flying Nobu, but not before he puts a small note on your face, it is an invitation for an upcoming robot championship title fight." marketFlavorTextColor

AddText "You enter the bay of a half destroyed Catpien, the landing place your contacts told you about, scarcely crewed by a nobu contigent, the infrastructure forces you to crouch and stumble as you try to talk to the portboss, it smells like the sea." marketFlavorTextColor

id: #WHY ARE YOU HERE THIS IS FOR WAY LATER ON, DO THINGS THAT YOU ACTUALLY CAN RIGHT NOW.

text: "Ocp asked me to get an special animal for her, it is very very secret. No one shall see you. Simple."
options: bluemoon_spaceoct_start:Ask about catching this curious animal

text: At the end of the bar, a rakish $bluemoon_spaceoct_manOrWoman is met by a variety of low-life characters who scurry away again almost immediately. Giving orders, perhaps.
options: bluemoon_spaceoct_startBar:Find out what the rakish $bluemoon_spaceoct_manOrWoman at the end of the bar is up to

text:
The $bluemoon_spaceoct_manOrWoman watches your approach. "You want in on the business, that right?" $heOrShe says, amused at your audacity.

"Let me give you a job so easy that any rad-addled spacer could manage it. But," $heOrShe shrugs regretfully, "It's a real shame how many of 'em just can't follow instructions and end up getting tossed out an airlock." $HeOrShe laughs like this is a good joke.

"Deliver the item to the specified location in $bluemoon_spaceoct_systemName, bluemoon_spaceoct_dist light years away." $HeOrShe flips a TriPad out of $hisOrHer coat. The display shows $bluemoon_spaceoct_aOrAnThing. "This is it. The reward is $bluemoon_spaceoct_reward credits. Don't be seen making the drop, and don't tell anyone about it."

$PersonName looks you over silently for a moment, then nods, seemingly satisfied.

"I don't want any questions, it's a simple task. Deliver this item to the specified location in $bluemoon_spaceoct_systemName bluemoon_spaceoct_dist light-years away. Don't be seen making the drop, and don't tell anyone about it. The reward bluemoon_spaceoct_reward credits." $HeOrShe taps at $hisOrHer datapad and your display is overlaid with bluemoon_spaceoct_aOrAnThing. 

"That is all there is to it. Do you accept my terms?"
Your $shipOrFleet was recently detected - or is currently being tracked by - a nearby fleet, and dropping off the item at the specified location is extremely inadvisable.
options:
bluemoon_spaceoct_scan:Drop it off in a stable orbit
defaultLeave:Leave

text:
Your nav officer reports that your $shipOrFleet has arrived at the coordinates provided by $bluemoon_spaceoct_personName. The $bluemoon_spaceoct_bait is held gently in a cargo drone's manipulator arms, ready for deployment.

The go-button flashes softly on your command interface.

The bay doors open, and the cargo drone extends its arms. Then, gently, its manipulators release.

It is now done. Whatever 'it' is.
